question_text: How does a bridge network address differ from a shared network configuration?
answer_options: It creates a separate IP subnet for each VM
It uses NAT instead of DHCP
It places VMs on the same IP subnet as the host
It prevents the VM from accessing any outside networks
correct_answer: It places VMs on the same IP subnet as the host
explanation: Bridge mode allows VMs to act like physical devices on the local LAN, sharing the same IP subnet.
